newsitem.title: GREECE: NOBEL LAUREATE ECONOMIST MODIGLIANI IN GREECE MAY 30.
newsitem.headline: NOBEL LAUREATE ECONOMIST MODIGLIANI IN GREECE MAY 30.

text.p: Nobel laureate economist Franco Modigliani, a professor at the Massachussets Institute of Technology (MIT), will lecture on "Europe's Unemployment Problem" May 30 at a conference organised by the Bank of Greece.

Modigliani who was awarded the Nobel prize in 1985 will be joined by professors Edmund Phelps from Columbia University, Christopher Pissaridis from the London School of Economics and Charles Wyplosz from the Centre for Economic Policy Research (CERP) in Geneva.
There will also be discussion by professors Giuseppe Bertola from the University of Turin and Gilles Saint-Paul from the Laboratory of Applied Economics in Paris.

Bank of Greece governor and Athens University professor Lucas Papademos will coordinate the discussion which will focus on problems caused by high unemployment rates in the EU -- the causative factors and the policy that can tackle the problem.

"The participant economists have devoted a significant part of their research on issues affecting the labour market and macroeconomic policies that boost employment," Greece's central bank said in a statement.
The conference will start at 17:00 local at the central bank in room N212. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
